data.title: One bent line
data.statement:
First, create a [[squareGrid]] of size [[gridSide]] by [[gridSide]], populated with [[backgroundChar]].
Assume the top-left point of that [[squareGrid]] is (0,0), and increases to the right and down.
 
You'll be given the ([[x]],[[y]]) of 3 points: A B and C.
Replace the [[backgroundChar]] with the [[foregroundChar]] for the line from [[pointA]] to [[pointB]] and the line from [[pointB]] to [[pointC]].

Note:
The lines are "crisp": they are at angles that are multiples of 45 degrees.  No rounding or complicated math is needed.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

First, create a squareGrid of size gridSide by gridSide, populated with backgroundChar.
Assume the top-left point of that squareGrid is (0,0), and increases to the right and down.

You'll be given the (x,y) of 3 points: A B and C.
Replace the backgroundChar with the foregroundChar for the line from pointA to pointB and the line from pointB to pointC.

Note:
The lines are "crisp": they are at angles that are multiples of 45 degrees. No rounding or complicated math is needed.
Input
Line 1: an integer, gridSide
Line 2: a 2-character-long string that is the backgroundChar followed by the foregroundChar
Line 3: 6 space-separated integers: x of pointA, y of pointA
x of pointB, y of pointB
x of pointC, y of pointC
Output
gridSide lines: squareGrid
Constraints
8 < gridSide < 32
all Points are on the squareGrid
Example
Input
10
-*
1 1 8 8 8 3
Output
----------
-*--------
--*-------
---*----*-
----*---*-
-----*--*-
------*-*-
-------**-
--------*-
----------
